cache.description:
The server cache stores temporary data to improve performance, especially statistics.
However, sometimes some data can become outdated or corrupted.

By clearing the cache, you force the server to re-calculate all data from the original source, which can resolve certain issues.
cache.title: Server Cache

computeAttendance.description:
Attendance is automatically synchronized/computed every night at 1 AM from the traces of MAC addresses scanned on the network. This means that all connected devices are tracked, even if they are not yet in the system.

You can manually trigger a synchronization between the traces and the attendance by specifying a particular period and/or a MAC address.

period.description: Specify a particular MAC period to synchronize. Leave empty for all addresses.
period.label: Period

computeAttendance.title: Synchronize attendance
